name: Cranberry Pecan Scones
author: M. Goldman
summary: Based on the traditional Scottish biscuits, these scones are packed with cranberries and crunchy pecans. You may add food coloring to the glaze if desired.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and cut into small pieces
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Combine 3/4 cup milk and vinegar in a bowl; let stand until milk is curdled, about 5 minutes
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and nutmeg in a large bowl; cut in butter with a pastry blender
Smooth remaining butter clumps with hands; stir in milk mixture, cranberries, and pecans
Knead until dough comes together in a ball
Place dough onto a floured work surface
Roll out with a rolling pin to 3/4-inch thickness
Cut into long, 2-inch wide strips with a sharp knife; cut strips into triangles
Bake in the preheated oven until tops are golden brown, about 15 minutes
Combine confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons milk in a small bowl; mix until combined
